byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and ASHLEY SOUTHALL
byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Cleveland, and Ashley Southall from New York. Rodney Bengston contributed reporting from Cleveland.

lead_paragraph: The white officer, Michael Brelo, climbed onto the hood of a car and fired repeatedly at an unarmed black couple. His trial played out amid broader questions about how the police interact with African-Americans.

headline.print_headline: Judge Acquits Cleveland Officer Who Fired 49 Shots at Couple
headline.main: Cleveland Police Officer Acquitted of Manslaughter in 2012 Deaths

snippet: The white officer, Michael Brelo, climbed onto the hood of a car and fired repeatedly at an unarmed black couple. His trial played out amid broader questions about how the police interact with African-Americans.
abstract: Judge John P O’Donnell finds white Cleveland Police Officer Michael Brelo not guilty of voluntary manslaughter in 2012 shooting deaths of Timothy Russell and Malissa Williams, unarmed black occupants of fleeing vehicle; says testimony did not prove that shots from Brelo's gun caused either death; black residents of city express grave disappointment at verdict but protests are peaceful.
